poem:
Title: Songbird, Still

From the sky her notes fall,
Caged in tendons hard as wrought iron,
Yet the melody still twists,
Bound within, ripe as a pomegranate,
A rhythm held captive,
Choreographed by a mercurial mind,
Its dance unseen, its music unheard,
Haunted by the phantom notes of a syndrome,
How she sings, the chanteuse, amid the silent screams,
Oh, Céline, against quiet, you reign.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Céline Dion documentary aims to ‘raise awareness’ of stiff person syndrome A new documentary about Céline Dion aims to educate about stiff person syndrome, the neurological disorder the singer has been diagnosed with. Amazon-MGM will release I Am: Céline Dion, a film that spans a year in the life of the globally successful singer as she deals with the condition that affects her spinal cord and brain. Related: What is stiff person syndrome and can". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Céline Dion documentary aims to ‘raise awareness’ of stiff person syndrome A new documentary about Céline Dion aims to educate about stiff person syndrome, the neurological disorder the singer has been diagnosed with. Amazon-MGM will release I Am: Céline Dion, a film that spans a year in the life of the globally successful singer as she deals with the condition that affects her spinal cord and brain.
